newsitem.title: USA: Mississippi River shut near Memphis by plant fire.
newsitem.headline: Mississippi River shut near Memphis by plant fire.

text.p: Shipping was halted along a 20-mile section of the Mississippi River south of Memphis on Thursday after a plant fire nearby spewed a cloud of toxic chemicals over the area, a U.S. Coast Guard spokesman said.
The river was closed between mileposts 650 and 670, delaying two northbound and five southbound tows on a relatively shallow stretch of river used by barges and tows, Coast Guard Lt. Eric Bauer said.
"We'll follow the advice (of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency) on when to open it back up," he said.

The explosion flattened part of a chemical plant in West Helena, Ark., and a fire sent thick black smoke into the sky laden with azinphos-methyl, an insecticide that attacks the central nervous system.
